subject: Economics
title: Rwanda's Revival: Development After Devastation
description: A micro-lesson that makes Rwanda's Revival: Development After Devastation usable.

hook.text: In 1994, Rwanda suffered a genocide that killed 800,000 people.

buildup.text: Under Paul Kagame, Rwanda invested in governance, technology, and health. Corruption is near-zero.

discovery.text: Rwanda leapfrogged: drones deliver blood to rural hospitals, 95% have health insurance.

twist.text: But Rwanda's success comes with political repression.

punchline.text: Rwanda built a miracle on discipline. The test is whether miracles need.

quiz.question: What is the central tension in Rwanda's development model?
options: Impressive economic and health achievements coexist with political repression, raising questions about whether development requires democracy
